biospec_descr.textblock: tissue specimens from endocarditis lesions and necrotizing fasciitis

brief_summary.textblock:
the aim of this study is to investigate the role of staphylokinase, streptokinase and MMP
      activation in invasive staphylococcal and streptococcal infections.

clinical_study.brief_title: Coagulation and Fibrinolysis as Virulence Factors for Invasive Staphylococcus Aureus and Streptococcus Infections

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all patients that undergo surgical treatment for invasive streptococcal or
             staphylococcal infections, including acute infective endocarditis and necrotizing
             fasciitis, from the UZ Leuven University Hospital

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

study_pop.textblock:
Material will be collected from all patients that undergo surgical treatment for invasive
        streptococcal or staphylococcal infections, including acute infective endocarditis and
        necrotizing fasciitis, from the UZ Leuven University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Coagulation and Fibrinolysis as Virulence Factors for Invasive Staphylococcus Aureus and Streptococcus Infections.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
